sentence.Network_en: I narrowly missed a cyclist who wobbled into my path.
sentence.Network_cn: 我险些被一个摇摇晃晃迎面而来的骑车人撞倒。

sentence.Network_en: A cyclist crashed when he touched wheels with another rider.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个骑车人与另一辆自行车车轮相碰后摔倒在地。

sentence.Network_en: The car narrowly missed a cyclist.
sentence.Network_cn: 汽车差点儿撞上一位骑自行车的人。

entry.def: A cyclist is someone who rides a bicycle, or is riding a bicycle.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who rides a bicycle

auth_sentence.content: Is Mark Cavendish the best cyclist in the world?
auth_sentence.res_content: Is Mark Cavendish the best cyclist in the world?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Is Mark Cavendish the best cyclist in the world?

auth_sentence.content: Sir Chris Hoy was no doubt the best cyclist.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sir Chris Hoy was no doubt the best cyclist.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sir Chris Hoy was no doubt the best cyclist.

auth_sentence.content: But what could a cyclist aspire to in Rwanda?
auth_sentence.res_content: But what could a cyclist aspire to in Rwanda?

sentences.en: The series of steep hills sapped the cyclists’ strength.
sentences.cn: 一连串坡度很大的小山耗尽了骑车人的气力。

sentences.en: The TV presenter found himself on the wrong side of the law after hitting a cyclist while driving.
sentences.cn: 那位电视节目主持人开车撞了一个骑自行车的人,他意识到自己惹上官司了。

sentences.en: We met a group of cyclists on a tour in the Lake District.
sentences.cn: 我们在湖区旅游时碰上了一队骑自行车的人。
